{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Summary
Switching the theme or changing any other settings in schedule settings can take more than 5 seconds to load when using IE 11 on Windows 10. Sometimes, IE is showing a script issue and ask whether to cancel it. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA version 1000.383.2 Cloud
* Portfolio Live Plan 2.0.9-OD-001-D20160923T012537 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create plan
# View the plan
# Change any of the settings in the Scheduled Settings (i.e Switching scheme)

h3. Expected Results
Loading time should be similar to other browser

h3. Actual Results
Loading time is slow

h3. Workaround
Use other browser except for IE 11. (Tested and seems to be working okay when using other browser)
fields.summary: Slow loading time when changing any of the settings in the Schedule Settings on IE11 (Windows 10)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Plan doesn't list all projects in the source
h3. Environment

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a board (project or filter)
 # Create a plan and add the source created on step one
 # Delete the board (project or filter) from step one
 ## The id of the deleted source will remain associated to the plan 
 ## One outcome of this bug is that not all projects are listed inside the plan even if it has valid sources.

h3. Expected Results

The source is removed from the plan and the plan loads as expected
h3. Actual Results

The association between the deleted source and the plan still exist and the plan doesn't load as expected
h3. Notes

 
h3. Workaround

Contact Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Plan doesn't list all projects in the source

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1674].
  {panel}

h3. Summary  
Currently, Portfolio allows custom fields that are not available for issues to be displayed in the Scope. When updating and committing the value of the custom field, the issue in JIRA gets updated with the value as well. The problem is that the custom field is not being used for the given issue/project. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Create a custom field such as a number field (Make sure it is not available on create, edit and view screens for your given project, but it is available for all projects (Project context: Global (all issues))
# Add the custom field to your plan by going to Configure > Custom Fields > Add Custom Field
# Update the custom field with a value and commit your changes
# The issue in JIRA is now updated with a value for the custom field (visible in change history), even though the custom field is not available on view and update screen for issue. 


h3. Expected Results  
Portfolio would not even show custom fields that are not associated with the project/filter

h3. Actual Results 
Portfolio displays custom fields that are not associated with the given project/filter

h3.Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: Portfolio allows custom fields that are not available for issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary 

In cases where scheduled intervals should be aggregated over multiple hierarchy levels and combine placeholder assignments based on target intervals and actual scheduled work assignments the wrong dates are picked.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Minimal example:
 !MinExample.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Result 

The scheduled end date of initiative i1 is set to the 30/Sep based on the scheduled end date of epic e1.

h3. Expected result

Since epic e1 has no estimates, the scheduled interval is based on so called placeholder assignments which are calculated based on the Target start and Target end values of e1 and its children. Epic e2 on the other hand has estimates and real work assignments. When aggregating the (placeholder) interval of e1 and the (scheduled) interval of e2 only the latter should be taken into account for initiative i1.

h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Scheduled interval aggregation bug over multiple hierarchy levels

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1407].
  {panel}

Description:
----------------
Portfolio Live Plans doesn't consider all available sprints from an agile board if the sprint belongs originally to another board.

Example:
-------------
Board A: Sprint A1
Board B : Sprint B1

Issue I1 : visible on Board A and Board B and is in scope of Sprint A1
Issue I2 : visible on Board A and Board B and is in scope of Sprint B1

When viewing Board A we will see not only Sprint A1 but also B1 because Issue I2 is visible on the board and is in scope of Sprint B1.
Same happens for Board B : Issue I1 is visible on the board and in scope of Sprint A1, therefore also A1 is visibible ins Board B.

As Portfolio Live Plans only considers sprints that directly belongs to a board (created within a board), meaning for issue I1 only sprint A1 and for issue I2 only sprint B1, the scheduling result is not as expected.
fields.summary: Portfolio Live Plans doesn't consider all available sprints from agile boards for scheduling

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1734].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

There are some cases where sprints imported into JPO do not match the dates with what is set into Agile. For instance, if you create a sprint with end date to some day after 10:00 PM, when in JPO, the end date will show up as the next day. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA v1000.571.2
* JIRA Agile v1000.165.0
* Portfolio for JIRA v2.1.6-OD-002-D20161121T003052

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a scrum project/board with a sprint set to start on _01/12 12:00 AM_ and end at _05/12 10:00 PM_
# Create a live plan and import that board
# View the sprint info on the timeline

h3. Expected Results
Sprint info should show that start date is _01/12_ and end date is _05/12_

h3. Actual Results
Sprint info is showing that start date is _01/12_ and end date is _06/12_
 
h3. Notes
This shift only happens if the sprint end date is set to a time after 10:00 PM. The problem does not happen if you set 09:59 PM or any time earlier.
Time may vary depending on the timezone.

h3.Workaround
Change the sprint end date to have a time earlier than 10:00 PM.
fields.summary: Sprint end date shifts one day

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Searching for the "Parent Link" field using the "IS EMPTY" or "IS NOT EMPTY" operators returns wrong results.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # While having Advanced Roadmaps active do the following search
{code:java}
"Parent Link" is not EMPTY
{code}

h3. Expected Results

The search should only return issues that have a value for the Parent Link field.
h3. Actual Results

The search return issues without a value for the Parent Link field.
 When using the "IS EMPTY" operator the search result excludes issues that don't have a value for the Parent Link and should appear.
h3. Workaround

Parent Link is not EMPTY considers 3 types of "parent links": Parent Link from Advanced Roadmaps, Epics and subtasks. To search issues with only the Parent Link custom field present, exclude the other possible links:
{code:java}
"Parent Link" is not EMPTY AND "Epic Link" is EMPTY
{code}
And to further exclude subtasks, if needed:
{code:java}
"Parent Link" is not EMPTY AND "Epic Link" is EMPTY AND issuetype in standardIssueTypes()
{code}
h3. Quick fix : 
 # For those issues not return the correct result. Check their *history.* 
 # Convert it from epic or higher -> other standard types( bug, task, story) and then convert it back 
 # You may lose the children links but you could relink them by retrieving the issue history 

h3. Notes

Other searches for specific results seem to be working normally. Searches using the IN operator work fine as well.

(!) In case you are using the workaround but the *"Parent Link" column is not being populated* with the issue key, then make sure that you have *permissions* on the project where the Parent issue is in.
fields.summary: Searching for the "Parent Link" field using "IS NOT EMPTY" returns inconsistent results

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When searching for issues in the Parent Link field on the create and edit issue screens in JIRA, the search only matches entire words or the entire issue key.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a new level in Portfolio Hierarchy Configuration
 # Add the Parent Link field to the Create or Edit screen in JIRA
 # Create a new issue of the Issue Type configured for the new level
 # Create or edit an epic and attempt to search for the issue created in step 3 in the Parent Link field in JIRA

h3. Expected Results

Partial text searches will match the issue. I.E. for an issue of *TEST-1 This is a test parent issue*, Typing "T" should match as would "p" or "par".
h3. Actual Results

Partial text searches will not match the issue, only typing the entire word or issue will will match:

For an issue of *TEST-1 This is a test parent issue*
 * "T" - No matches
 * "p" - No matches
 * "par" - No matches
 * "TEST-1" - Matches
 * "This" - Matches
 * "parent" - Matches

h3. Workaround

Search using full words
fields.summary: Text search for Parent Link field only matches on full tokens (words, issue keys)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Portfolio's JQL function "portfolioChildIssuesOf" does not fetch all transitive children of issues in classic JSD projects

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Have a classic JSD project with at least one issue with an issue type mapped to Portfolio's Epic and one on Story level. Those should have a parent-child relation.
Make a Portfolio plan with said project and verify the parent-child relation is properly shown in the Scope table.
Go to the issue search and try "portfolioChildIssusOf($issueKeyOfParent)"

h3. Expected Results
The child is found by the issue search.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing is found by the issue search.


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: portfolioChildIssuesOf JQL misses children for classic JSD project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you swap the scheduling behavior on the Portfolio Dependency settings, the issues' dependencies stop being displayed on the Portfolio Dependencies report

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud
* Portfolio for Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a plan based on a board
# Add a dependency (Blocks, for example) to one issue and commit it to Jira
# Recalculate your plan
# Go to *Portfolio settings > Portfolio Dependencies*
# Next to the dependency name, click *Swap* in order to make the settings be like *If A blocks B then B is scheduled before A*
# Click the *Save changes* button
# Go back to your plan and click *Calculate* button to recalculate your plan
# Go to *Reports > Dependencies*

h3. Expected Results
The dependencies are displayed on the report

h3. Actual Results
The dependencies are *not* displayed on the report

 !Screen Shot 2018-04-20 at 4.53.47 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes


h3.Workaround

Define the Dependency settings like *If A blocks B then A is scheduled before B*.
fields.summary: Dependencies stop being displayed on the Portfolio Dependencies report when dependencies scheduled settings is swapped

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1473].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If issues in Portfolio are sorted according to a column, and that column is later hidden/collapsed, the sort remains in effect. There is no visual indication of this, and as issues are sorted by a column, they cannot be reprioritised.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a plan
# Add some issues.
# Drag to reprioritise.
# This will work. 
# Sort the issues by a column (e.g. click on the estimates column header to sort by estimates).
# Hide the estimates column.
# The issues remain sorted by the column, but there is no visual indication of this.
# Try to drag the issues to reprioritise.
# The issues cannot be moved.

h3. Expected Results
The sort should automatically be removed when the column is hidden/collapsed.

h3.Workaround
Expand/un-collapse columns until you find the one the issues are sorted by (the column header will have a grey background). Click on the column header to un-apply the sort. Re-hide the columns if desired. Issues are now displayed in priority order and can be drag-and-dropped to reprioritise.

Alternatively, the table can be sorted by the _Title_ column (which cannot be hidden) first and then sorting can be un-applied by clicking the title column two more times (first click changes sort direction, second takes the table back to their default sort order by rank which allows for rank operations).
fields.summary: Cannot reprioritize issues if they are sorted by a hidden column

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1704].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The JIRA Portfolio "Working hours and days" setting is not respecting the Global Time Tracking despite the grayed out value being the one it should be.

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud:
Portfolio for JIRA v2.1.2-OD-004

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Create a new plan with one team
- Change your Time Tracking Global setting to be 5 hours per day. 
- Go to the plan settings in Portfolio: Settings -> Working Hours and Days. It shows a default of 5 hours per day grayed out.
- Add a person to the team in Portfolio
- Notice that under weekly hours it says 40 (even though the default number hours of day = 5 -> 25hrs/week)

h3. Expected Results
The user in the team should have 25h working hours.

h3. Actual Results
The user have 40h.
 
h3. Notes
If you change the number of hours per week in the Portfolio Settings "Working Hours and Days" to 5, the weekly hours changes to 25 in the user on the team, so it behaves as if the actual value of the Workday hours is 8 though the default should be 5.

h3.Workaround
Manually set the Working hours and days in Portfolio plan.
fields.summary: Portfolio Plan not respecting Time Tracking Global Working hours of JIRA.

fields.description:
h3. Description
Each time we try to assign a new person to a ticket that already has someone assigned.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a project
# Create an issue
# Assign to a person
# Create a new Portfolio plan and use the created project as source
# At the Portfolio, create a team and add real users
# Update the issue with a new user
# Try to commit
# The error will be observed.

h3. Expected results
Portfolio should commit and write the new assignee.

h3. Actual results.
If the ticket is new, meaning just entering the plan with no previous assignee, it seems to work ok. 
But if the ticket was already assigned, and you are changing the assignee, it will not allow you to commit.

h3. Workaround
Please contact the support to apply the workaround
fields.summary: Portfolio Errors each time we attempt to commit changes to the Assignee or Team

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1630].
  {panel}

*Summary*
JIRA performance is generally low, the instance might run out of memory and garbage collection is running constantly and takes very long.

*Steps to reproduce*
At the current stage of investigation we believe this is related to Portfolio's _Parent link_ field search that was added 2.0.6. That is, when you try to search for parents in JIRA's Create or Edit issue dialogs, this may lead to memory problems on larger instances. This problem is aggravated by the fact that every keystroke triggers a new search request.
Another problem is the related search for Portfolio child issues. This is triggered when opening issues above story level in Portfolio.

*Workaround*
To stop this problem from re-occurring, remove the Portfolio parent link field from all screens in your JIRA instance to keep people from triggering the parent search which is the suspected source of trouble.
There is currently no workaround available to prevent the child issue search.

We are working on this issue with highest priority and should be able to provide a fix soon.
fields.summary: Possible performance issues and out-of-memory exceptions on larger instances when searching for Portfolio parents or child issues in JIRA

fields.description:
h2. Problem
Certain issues appear a little stubs at the left end of the schedule, as shown in below screenshot:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
This happens when an issue is unestimated, unestimated issues scheduling is set to [_Base on target datses_|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfoliocloud/scheduling-unestimated-items-based-on-target-dates-838541841.html] and the issue is assigned to a release with a dynamic start date (_As early as possible_) and a fix end date before the start of the timeline.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h2. Expected result
Unestimated issues should not derive their duration from releases with negative durations (where the start date is computed to be after a fixed end date) and thus not show up in the schedule

h2. Workarounds
To overcome the visual problems, you can set a date range filter (can be found in the _More_ filters button) that starts from the earliest fixed end date set on the releases of the plan. This, however, does not solve the underlying problem that unestimated items should not derive negative durations from releases.
fields.summary: Unestimated issues derive their duration from releases with negative durations

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, if the user is given permission to view the plan from the plan *Permission Configuration* but not in the *Portfolio Administration* page the Portfolio plan keeps reloading

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add *Group A* to have *Portfolio Viewer* permission in *Portfolio Administration* page. 
# Add single user (which is not member of *Group A*) to have permission to view the plan (*Plan* > *Configure* > *Permissions*) on plan level 

h3. Expected Results
The user can see the plan or a message is displayed that the user should have Portfolio Viewer permission. 

h3. Actual Results
The plan keeps reloading
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
Always give the *Portfolio Viewer* permission first and then restrict further on plan level
fields.summary: The plan keeps reloading if the user only has permission to view the plan but doesn't have global Potfolio Viewer permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When selecting multiple filters for the scope view (releases, teams, teams etc..) without waiting for the plan to load the backlog search breaks and an exception is thrown.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Open your Portfolio plan
# On the scope view select multiple filters at once (releases, teams, teams etc..)
 !Screen Shot1.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Expected Results

The scope should reload applying the selected filters.

h3. Actual Results
The backlog calls return a 500 error and an exception is thrown.
!Screen Shot2.png|thumbnail! 

Exception:
{code}

fields.description:
h2. Problem
When opening a portfolio plan, loading issues times out and results in a bummer that shows a nested {{ERROR: canceling statement due to statement timeout}}. While there are several reasons for why this might happen, we have identified this to happen on instances that have plans with many excluded issues across all their plans.

h2. Work-around
No feasible work-around

We are working on this with high priority
fields.summary: Plans might not load on instances that have many excluded issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1356].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Committing  issues in portfolio returns an error due to wrong user-property for the reporter field. This error is caused by changing the username where user-key is not equal to the username.
h3. Environment
* Version: 1.12.4-OD-D20160322T001113

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create issue to Portfolio plan
# Click on the Uncommitted change button to sync with JIRA

h3. Exception when trying to commit a created ticket

{code:java}
com.atlassian.jpo.scenario.common.data.ScenarioCommitException: Scenario commit error


Caused by com.atlassian.jpo.env.issues.EnvironmentIssueCreateException: Specific error details : {reporter=The reporter specified is not a user.}

  at com.atlassian.jpo.env.issues.JiraIssueService.createIssue:302
  at com.atlassian.jpo.env.issues.JiraIssueService.createIssue:92
  at com.atlassian.jpo.scenario.issue.ScenarioIssueCreateAction.performApiOperation:53
  at com.atlassian.jpo.scenario.issue.ScenarioIssueModificationAction.perform:185
{code}


h3. Expected Results
Issue is synced successfully
h3. Actual Results
Issue is not synced and error change couldn't be synced shown

h3.Workaround
The user could change their username to be equal to the initial one, which is the user-key
fields.summary: Issues created in Live Plans cannot be committed due to wrong user-property for the reporter field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1750].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When creating a Story within an Epic in Portfolio, if there is the following validator on the create transition:
{quote}If a value for field Epic Link is not provided during the transition, show the following error: Epic LInk must be filled-in.{quote}

The Story creation will fail. In this case with "Epic LInk must be filled-in.":
 !Screen Shot 2016-12-08 at 3.50.15 PM.png|thumbnail! 

The issue should be resolved by setting the *Epic Link* field as required in the _field configuration_. However, it isn't possible to do so since the said field is LOCKED.

h3. Environment
Cloud - JIRA v1000.620.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set a *Field Required Validator* to the *Create* transition for Stories.
# Within a plan in Portfolio, create a Story under an Epic.
# Commit the changes
# You'll be prompted the _Set required fields_ screen. However, the *Epic Link* isn't listed.

h3. Expected Results
Since the Story is being created from within an Epic, the Epic Link field shouldn't be required to be filled-in.

h3. Actual Results
Story creation fails due to the validator and not having the possibility to fill in the Epic Link field.
 
h3.Workaround
Remove validator, use required field instead.
fields.summary: It isn't possible to create a Story within an Epic if there is a validator requiring Epic Link not be empty

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-489].
  {panel}

While using the filter search ability on the "Import Existing Issues" screen, if you start the search with a question mark (standard search wildcard for "any one character"), the search crashes.

h2. Repro Steps:
1. On a JIRA system with JIRA Portfolio installed, launch Portfolio and open/create a Plan.
2. From the Backlog screen, use the "Import Issues" button to open the "Import Existing Issues" screen
3. In the filter select dropdown, type in a question mark (?).

h2. Result: 
An error message appears suggesting the system has crashed (it has not, but most users would take this message to mean it had)

h2. Expected Result:
No error should occur or at least the error message should be more like the equivalent warning in the JIRA Issue Navigator that explains that characters is a reserved character and can't be used at the beginning of the word.
fields.summary: The "Import Existing Issue" select filter crashes if you start the search with "?" as the first letter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-527].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Have a JPO plan set
# Run a filter on the epics
# Click the drop-down arrow next to the 'details'
# Select the option 'Move to initiative'
# Move to initiative screen will show up
# Select the new initiative
# Hit 'Move'

*Expected Results:*
The epic should be updated with the new initiative and the page refreshed.

*Actual Results:*
The epic is receiving the new initiative, but the page stuck on that screen:
 !Screen Shot 2015-10-07 at 7.09.38 PM.png|thumbnail! 

*Workaround:*
Refresh the page manually.

*Add-on Version:*
JPO 1.10.5
fields.summary: Move epic to initiative after filtering does not refresh the page
Issues in projects with hidden fix version field are not imported into Live Plans

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Exclude an issue from a plan
2. Edit the issue sources for a plan
3. In the final step of the wizard, the excluded issue incorrectly appear as checked. Unchecking and re-checking the issue does not re-include the issue back into the plan.

This only affects our latest Cloud release. A fix for this has been developed and will be released to Cloud shortly.
fields.summary: Issues can't be re-included once they have been excluded from a plan

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The message "This issue's assignee is ignored because they aren't part of the plan" in the plan's issue detail view, although the issue's assignee is a team member in the plan

h3. Environment

* Jira Software cloud
* Portfolio for Jira cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Portfolio plan
# Create one or more teams in the Portfolio team, adding the assignees of some issues to the team or teams
# Set the "Assignee import level" to "Story" (or other levels)
# Click the "Calculate" button

h3. Expected Results

The plan is scheduled and calculated properly

h3. Actual Results

The message "This issue's assignee is ignored because they aren't part of the plan" is displayed in issues which have an assignee

https://cl.ly/7a9dcc81799d

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround

Please contact the support to apply the workaround
fields.summary: Portfolio warns the assignee is ignored because they are not part of the plan but the user is in the plan

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Having an Epic created under an Initiative A and converting this Epic into an Initiative B will not remove the Parent Link association and Portfolio understands that there is an existing link between the two issues.
With that, if you complete the Initiative A and Initiative B is still in progress, Portfolio will keep the Initiative A in the Scope Table and will not be removed as Portfolio thinks that there is still pending work for this Initiative.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Initiative A
# Create an Epic
# Link the Epic to the Initiative A
# Convert the Epic into an Initiative B

h3. Expected Results
The Parent Link should be removed between the Epic and Initiative

h3. Actual Results
The Parent Link is kept, causing to Portfolio understand that there is still an active link between the issues. With that, if you complete the Initiative A and Initiative B is still in progress, Portfolio will keep the Initiative A in the Scope Table and will not be removed as Portfolio thinks that there is still pending work for this Initiative.

h3. Workaround
Please, contact Atlassian Support to fix the issue
fields.summary: Converting an Epic into an Initiative does not remove existing Parent Link association
Subtasks influence the scheduling priority of their parent issue in Live Plans

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-530].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
JIRA Portfolio does not display Scheduling information

h3. Environment
This issue can be replicated with JIRA Portfolio 1.10.5 on a compatible version of JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
This issue can be replicated following the steps below: 
# Filter against a single release, team, theme or stage
# Delete the filtered release, team, theme or stage
# Recalculate the Plan. 

h3. Expected Results
Scheduling should be displayed

h3. Actual Results
No scheduling result is shown. Instead a message saying "The current result set does not contain any initiatives/epics/stories."

h3. Notes
This appears to be the same as the issue identified in: [The current scheduling result does not contain any initiatives in JIRA Portfolio - Atlassian Answers - Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/10390163/getting-the-current-scheduling-result-does-not-contain-any-initiatives.-in-jira-portfolio

h3. Workaround
# Enable ALL the Filters (using the checkboxes)
# Disable ALL the Filters (by deselecting all items)
# The Scheduling should now be shown as expected.
fields.summary: No scheduling result when filtering on a deleted criteria

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1728].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The New Feature issue type is a Standard issue type. However it is not shown under Stories in the Portfolio Plan if it is part of an Epic.


h3. Environment
Portfolio Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project with issues of type *New Feature*
# Add those issues to an Epic
# One *New Feature* issue should not be added to an Epic:
#*  !New feature issue type in Backlog.png|thumbnail!  
# Create a Portfolio Plan (Issue source: the project created)
# The Hierarchy level in Portfolio administration is as following:
#*  !Hierarchy levels.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Expected Results
All issues with *New Feature* issue type should be shown in the Portfolio Plan

h3. Actual Results
The issues with *New Feature* issue type are not shown in the Portfolio Plan under Epic. Only the issues which are not part of an Epic are shown.

*  !New feature issue type in Portfolio Plan.png|thumbnail! 
 

h3.Workaround
You can use issue type Story/Bug/Task instead
fields.summary: New feature issue type not shown in Portfolio plan if it is under Epic
про

fields.description:
Balsamiq images in JIRA issues are not rendered correctly in Plans when viewing issues in the issue detail view. They are being displayed as URL links.

h3. Environment
* JIRA {{1000.621.5}}
* Portfolio for JIRA {{2.1.6-OD-006-D20161212T101811}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a plan in Portfolio
# In one of the issues in the plan, add a Balsamic mockup image.
 !jira issue.png|thumbnail! 
# Access the plan in Portfolio

h3. Expected Results
The Balsamiq image to be rendered as per the JIRA Issue.

h3. Actual Results
The image is displayed as a link instead:
 !plan.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
None at the moment
fields.summary: Balsamiq images in issues are displayed as links in plan's scope

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The *Child Issues* section is missing on the full page view of the parent issue (new Jira issue view).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a portfolio hierarchy
# Create a plan and set up a parent with child issues
# Open the parent issue in the full page view

h3. Expected Results

The child issues should be shown in the parent issues

 !old view.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

No indications of child issues exist for the parent issue.

 !new view.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

Switch to the old issue view by disabling the new Jira issue view feature on the profile settings.
fields.summary: Child issues section missing in the new JIra issue view.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1537].
  {panel}

h5. Problem summary:

Trying to exclude issues in the final step of the "Create Plan" process will fail if the user do not have EDIT Issue permission in the Permission Scheme or in the Workflow transition used.
h5. Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a user that does not have the 'edit issues' permission for a project
2. Try to create a plan based on that project. In the final step, exclude an issue.
3. Press 'Done'
4. An error is shown
h5. Expected results:

Provide a clear description of the problem in the UI for users to proceed next step, example:
{quote}"Cannot create plan due to lack of edit privileges for tickets: ......"
{quote}
OR, no error thrown. 
h5. Workaround:
 - Give the user the 'edit issues' permission for the issues they wish to exclude.

fields.summary: Exception when excluding issues without the 'edit issues' permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Planned Capacity in Release report is showing incorrect number when planning unit is changed

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Have a plan and some issues in it (planning unit set to *hours*)
# Add some estimations
# Check the planned capacity in Release Report (ie. it shows 50 hours)
# Change the planning unit in the configuration to *days*
# Calculate
# Check the planned capacity in Release report

h3. Actual Result

The number of planned capacity is not converted to days, it shows 50 days

h3. Expected Result

The number of planned capacity is converted to days.
fields.summary: Planned Capacity in Release report is showing incorrect number when planning unit is changed
This issue is related to the attach file option in the send my gift application

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1740].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Searching for Team via JQL doesn't surface sub-tasks in the results
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set team on sub-task
 # Search for Team via JQL

h3. Expected Results

Show all issues that are related to the team
h3. Actual Results

Shows all issues related to team except for sub-tasks
fields.summary: Sub-tasks don't appear when searching for Team via JQL

fields.summary: NoSuchElementException when calculating Portfolio schedule

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1376].
  {panel}

When using Jira Live plan in the scope screen.

I  toggle the status filter to  "Show open and completed issues" the scope screen still does not show delivered or accepted stories

Screenshot of live plan (13 issues)
 !image-2016-04-04-12-40-10-936.png|thumbnail! 

Screenshot of release (50 Issues)
 !image-2016-04-04-12-40-57-562.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Live Plan Scope not honouring Status Filter

fields.description:
*Summary*

The green inline create button is not showing when customers hover in between issue rows. Some customers were able to workaround it by using + button on the left of the issue to add child issues, however customers can't use the same workaround for to add issues that have child issues.

 

*Step to reproduce:*

Mouse over in between issue rows.

 

*Expected Result:*

Green inline button will show up (Refer to Screen Shot 2019-09-24).

 

*Actual Result:*

No inline button
fields.summary: Inline create button is not showing when hovering between issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1332].
  {panel}

While testing out the Labs feature Live Plans, we're seeing some performance issues.

This is the REST endpoint causing the slowness:
/rest/jpo/1.0/plan/setup/projects

This operation takes *226* seconds for us. Most of the time is spent querying this table it seems: *ao_60db71_lexorank*

Stats:
1.5+ millions issues
600+ projects
fields.summary: Creating a portfolio Live Plan takes a long time on large instances

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1487].
  {panel}

While the capacity view is showing or the schedule is closed an error is thrown when selecting an item in the Scope table.

*Wordaround*
Switch back to the schedule in order to make the table selection work.

Fix has been released in 2.0.2 for server customers. Fix for cloud customers has also been released (v2.0.3-OD-001).
fields.summary: Error when selecting issues in the scope table with capacity view showing or the schedule is closed

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On huge plans, the CTRL-F browser search is not returning the correct results on the new UI


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a huge plan scope
# Do a search string on the Issues ID, using the CTRL-F browser search 

h3. Expected Results

The browser should highlight all the issues within the plan that matches the search string.

h3. Actual Results

h4. Summary
Estimation changes do not take place after commit if only it is only a one-time change

h4. Steps to reproduce
#  Import issue into JIRA Portfolio live plan
# Set estimation to 20 hours (This will be automatically distributed among configured stages, lets say 3 stages with 5/10/5)
# Now change their estimates so that it is divided between the stages as (0/0/20)
# Log 8 hours of work on that issue in JIRA side
# The remaining estimate in JIRA is now 12 hours (while estimation in JPO still shows 20 hours)
# The user now commits his change

h4. Expected Result
The remaining estimate in JIRA is now 20 hours

h4. Actual Result
The remaining estimate in JIRA is now 12 hours

h4. Additional information
# This bug only happens for the changes in such a way that the total estimation remains the same. As the above steps, total estimation stays at 20 hours.
# In addition, this is also reproducible only when the user does one-time changes. In this case, user just changes from 5/10/5 to 0/0/20. If the customer makes another changes before committing, the bug does not happen. For example, user changes from 5/10/5 to 0/0/20 to 0/10/10.
fields.summary: Estimation changes do not take place after commit if it is only a one-time change

h3. Summary

If we have default resolution set in JIRA, committing issues through live plans causes the new tickets created in the process to have a Resolution Date, though no Resolution.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project
# Create a Portfolio plan and add the project as an issue source
# Go to Resolutions page in JIRA (type g+g >> resolutions, under https://instance.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewResolutions.jspa)
# Select a resolution as default
# Add an issue to the plan
# Commit it so it's created in JIRA

h3. Expected Results
The ticket is created without Resolution Date, as it doesn't have a resolution.

h3. Actual Results
It's created with no Resolution (as expected), but with a Resolution Date (not expected):
!resolution_problem.png|thumbnail!


h3.Workaround

h4. Workaround 1
# Unset default resolution (in 'Clear defaults') in Resolutions page
# Commit
# Set the default resolution back

h4. Workaround 2 (suggested in comments below)
# Change the 'Create' transition for this issue
# Add a post-function to clear the 'resolution' (not resolution date)
#* This should also clean the resolution date
fields.summary: Default Resolution causes issues to be committed with Resolution Date

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1527].
{panel}
h2. Description

In some rare situations it is possible for a plan to accumulate "phantom" changes. The uncommitted changes indicator shows 1 or more changes, but on opening the commit dialog, none are visible.
h2. Workaround
h3. Cloud:

# Navigate to the plan
# Click on ( ... ) > Configure > Scenario (If it's not enabled, please enable it)
# Create a new scenario (If there's already one, please proceed to the next step)
# Create another scenario > Create from _Copy of Initial Scenario_ for backup purposes.
# Create another Scenario but this time, create with blank scenario
# There should be now a scenario without "ghost changes" (the blank scenario)
# Delete the other scenario and use the blank scenario that has no "Ghost changes"

h3. Server:

*WARNING:* This will remove ALL uncommitted changes for the plan. Make sure you commit/revert all your changes prior to attempting this.

There is a hidden plan configuration screen that allows for resetting all pending changes (including but not limited to the phantom ones). This will make the phantom changes go away. This configuration screen can be accessed as follows:
 # Enable the com.atlassian.portfolio.plan.ExtendedAdministration dark feature on the JIRA instance.
 # Visit the plan configuration screen (open the plan, click the three-dot menu next to the plan name, then choose Configure).
 # Click on the new Extended Administration section in the column on the left (the dark feature makes this visible).
 # Confirm that you want to reset uncommitted changes.
fields.summary: Uncommitted changes indicator shows changes, but none are visible in commit dialog

fields.description:
h3. Problem
A portfolio plan starts in the past even though none of its active sprints matches up with the plan start. This happens because Portfolio also considers active sprints that have been excluded from the plan via a team's sprint assignment dialog when determining the plan start date.

h3. Workaround
Check your plan's Scrum teams for excluded sprints via the team cards drop-down menu option _Assign sprints_. Check the boards of teams that have excluded sprints for active past sprints and close them.
fields.summary: Excluded active sprints still contribute to plan start date

fields.description:
*Problem*
For certain types of issue source JQLs Portfolio might not hit pull in all issues the query hits into a plan. This affects all JQLs potentially hitting *all* issues of an instance that also contain a project clause, e.g., {{project = FOO OR assignee in (someUser)}}. Any JQL that is not restricted to a single project might be affected. For these JQLs Portfolio incorrectly only pulls in the projects explicitly specified as part of the JQL but not the ones hit by the additional clauses. As a consequence of this, Portfolio does not properly include versions of the missing projects and will hence exclude issues of these projects that have a fix version assignment.

You can test if you are affected by creating a new plan, selecting your issue source, move from the versions to the teams step and back and compare if you see the same list of projects on the versions page when coming back as you did initially.

*Expected behaviour*
Portfolio pulls in all issues hit by the issue source JQLs

*Actual behaviour*
Portfolio only pulls in all issues that are part of projects explicitly mentioned in the JQLs and those without fix versions of the others

*Workaround*
None
fields.summary: Issues are missing in Portfolio plan for certain issue source JQLs

fields.description:
The scheduling configuration for the minimum work package size above the on epic level or above is not correctly working. This concerns the schedule calculation of estimates put directly on epics or issues above the epic hierarchy level.

Reproduce:
Consider the following plan setup:
* one team with a velocity of 30 points
* two epics with an estimate of 29 points
* Minimum work package size 5 points

result: epic1 is scheduled completely in the first sprint, epic2 has one point scheduled in the first sprint and 28 in the second

expected result: epic 1 is scheduled completely in the first sprint, epic2 is scheduled completely in the second sprint

Only if the minimum work package size is set to a value smaller of equal 1 should the first result occur.
fields.summary: 'Minimum work package size' scheduling option is not respected

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Issues that have been transitioned into a "Closed" status (Closed, Done, Completed, etc) but do not have a Resolution set, do not show on their Portfolio Plan even with the Plan configured to show "Open and Completed Issues"

h3. Environment
* Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a workflow transition that transitions an issue to a "Closed" status but does not set the Resolution Field
# Associate the Project to a Plan by either using the Project or the Project's Filter as the Plans Issue Source
# Transition an issue to the "Closed" status
# Set the Plans view to show "Open and Completed Issues" (More > Status)

h3. Expected Results
All Open and Closed Issues appear

h3. Actual Results
Closed Issues that do not have a Resolution set do not show on the Plan

h3. Notes
The issue may be in a Status of "closed" however in JIRA, this issue is not seen as Completed; if and only when the Resolution Field is populated is an Issue considered done.

h3.Workaround
Set the Resolution Field on these "Closed" issues: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Issues+Need+a+Resolution
The "Closed" issues should reappear on the Plan as long as the "Open and Completed Issues" Status View filter is selected.
fields.summary: Closed Issues Without a Resolution Do Not Show on Plan

at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:39)
at webwork.interceptor.NestedInterceptorChain.proceed(NestedInterceptorChain.java:31)
at webwork.interceptor.ChainedInterceptor.intercept(ChainedInterceptor.java:16)
at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:35)
at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:225)
at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:154)
at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.service(JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.java:152)
at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:727)
...
Caused by: com.atlassian.rm.common.env.EnvironmentServiceException: Unknown filter: 24562
at com.atlassian.jpo.env.jql.JiraJqlIssueSourceTranslator.translateFilter(JiraJqlIssueSourceTranslator.java:116)
at com.atlassian.jpo.env.jql.JiraJqlIssueSourceTranslator.translate(JiraJqlIssueSourceTranslator.java:75)
... 204 more{code}
 
h4. Cause
 * The plan is referencing a filter that is to no longer exists or contains a JQL that cannot be parsed.
 * The plan is using an Agile board, which is then using a JQL filter that no longer exists or cannot be parsed.

h4. Expectation

The plan is loaded, indicating that the data has changed or is no longer available. It would show the configuration details of which Agile board is referenced or filter ID is being used.
h4. Actual

 The 500 page is presented and the user will have no course of action to understand how to fix the issue or what caused it.
h4. Workaround
 * Fix the filter being referenced by the Plan and ensure it is valid
 ** If plugin functionality is referenced, ensure that the plugin is installed and enabled or remove the plugin functions in the JQL
 * If the filter is no longer available, create a new filter and update the database, setting the new filter's ID to be the same as the originally referenced ID. A restart of JIRA is required after the change
fields.summary: Plan fails to load due to Invalid JQL or unable to translate

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1355].
  {panel}

Steps to recreate:
# Assign a user to a story in JIRA detail view
# In Portfolio: manually assign a member to a story (even if you manually assign the same person as the assignee)
# Recalculate
# Deselect the member and recalculate

Expect: The member to be the assignee of the JIRA issue
Actual: Story is assigned to team member without being informed by JIRA assignee.

Workaround: Also deselect the team and recalculate

fields.description:
Portfolio users who have their plan based off an issue source that is a board or filter may not get a scheduling result and thus see nothing in their timeline.
 This occurs for issue sources that go beyond the basic query usually associated with a board (which is its associated project query). From our current investigations, it seems like queries that are more complex than
 * _project in (<projectKey1>, ..., <projectKey n>) ORDER BY rank_
 * _project = <projectKey> ORDER BY rank__ _

result in this problem. That is 
 * _project = <projectKey> AND (issuetype is Epic) ORDER BY rank__ _

would not yield a scheduling result, the same goes for
 * _issuetype in (Story, Task, Epic) ORDER BY rank__ ASC_

or the like.

We are aware of the severity of this problem and are working on it with highest priority. A fix is already in the making.
fields.summary: No scheduling result for plans based on certain JQLs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-531].
  {panel}

So I noticed with the following configuration where auto-sync is on and update estimates is on, and progress metric is story points where progress tracking for stories is via time spent and remaining estimate, the following loop happens causing estimates in both JIRA P and linked JIRA Issue to decrease even when no work has been logged.
For this example let's say we have an issue that is 10 story points, The total estimated time is 25 hours, 10 of those hours are for a Subtask
1. log work on a subtask under the issue. (lets say 4 hours)
2. Refresh your Portfolio so that progress is updated
3. Plan> Update From Date. -- Since work has been done on the issue, the estimate is reduced, (i.e. we are now looking at a remaining estimate) which makes sense. We have worked 4 out of the 25 total hours, i.e.16% and so that would be 1.6 out of the 10 original story points, so we now have a remaining estimate of  8.4 story points. Confirm the update
4. Refresh the Issue, you will see that because the estimates are synced, the story points for that issue says 8.4.
5. Plan >Update From Date-- even though no work has been logged on the issue, it is updating the remaining estimate. I.e. the story points say 8.4, you have completed 16% of work on the original estimate, so reduce 8.4 by 16% and now the remaining estimate is 7.056.
6. Refresh the issue, story point estimate is now 7.056
7. Plan > Update From Date-- even though no work has been logged it sees 7.056 and that 16% of the time based estimate is completed so reduces remaining estimate to 5.92
And so on and so forth.

If no work has been logged since the last update, when I do a plan update it should not adjust/suggest this new estimate. Otherwise I have to remember if there has been progress since the last update and then accept/reject the suggested remaining estimate accordingly.
fields.summary: Problem with Update From Date and Auto-sync-- Endless Loop

h2. Problem
Portfolio plan page does not load, a red bummer message pops up and opening the browser console shows the following error message:

{code:java}
com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-plan-scripts.js?locale=en-US:9 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'get' of undefined
at com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-plan-scripts.js?locale=en-US:9

at Function.a.parse (com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-plan-scripts.js?locale=en-US:9)
at Object.handleLoadedTeams (com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-plan-scripts.js?locale=en-US:57)
at Object.<anonymous> (com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-plan-scripts.js?locale=en-US:57)

at n (com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-common-shared-scripts.js?locale=en-US:262)
{code}

This happens when a team with excluded sprints is loaded asynchronously for the plan, e.g. because a team not part of this plan is set on an issue or a new team with excluded sprints was added in parallel and the plan is refiltered or recalculated.

h2. Workaround
Dismiss the error message (open details and then hit close) and click the filter button (little magnifying glass).

We have already identified the problem and are working on a fix.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1511].
  {panel}

In some situations, it was possible for a script error to be triggered when issues are loaded. One way of triggering this is:

1. Open two browser tabs.
2. In one tab, create a new release, and a new issue that is assigned to that release. Commit these changes.
3. In the second tab, trigger loading of new issues (e.g. by filtering for something).
4. A script error occurs.

Opening the issue details panel could also trigger this in some situations.
fields.summary: Potential script error when loading issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1049].
  {panel}

Certain date formats that are accepted in JIRA as _Date/Month/Year_ format are not accepted by Portfolio's date picker. The problem here was that the year format was specified in upper-case Ys (e.g., dd.MM.YYYY) which is correctly interpreted in JIRA but causes the date picker in Portfolio not to open / accept manually input dates.

*Workaround:*
Change the upper-case _Y_ to lower-case _y_

Original bug report:
bq.As far as I know, this is already known bug, however, I wasn't able to find it. We are not able to choose date from date time picker in any section of JIRA Portfolio. Could you please update us on this bug, is this fixed in some version or we should still wait? Regards, Jelena
fields.summary: Portfolio date picker doesn't support all date formats that are accepted by JIRA

Just like the *Start date* and *Target due date* fields, the data should be present in Cloud.

h3. Actual Results

The field is empty.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you many Projects/Filters/Boards as issue source in your Plan, although your Plan will work normally, you cannot edit its Issue Source anymore as the scrollbar is not working. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# With our *Improved Interface* enabled, create a plan and select at least 13 sources as Issue Source (until you trigger a scrollbar in the UI)
# Click Next for the following options and Save your Plan
# Try to edit your Issue Source after that. The scrollbar will not appear and you won't be able to Edit your Issue Source anymore.

h3. Expected Results
You'll be able to Edit your Issue Source if needed:
 !Edit Issue Source working.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
You cannot edit your Issue Source anymore:
 !Edit Issue Source not available.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
* *Disable the Improved Interface* by accessing Configure > ADVANCED > Planning Interface from the affected Plan
fields.summary: Issue source cannot be edited anymore if you have too many sources

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a plan contains an issue source based on a filter using the Portfolio's Parent Link custom field, the hierarchy in the scope table will be corrupted.

h3. Reproduce
Create an initiative level and an initiative
Create an epic and set the initiative in the Parent link field
Create a filter "key in (INITIATIVE-KEY) OR parent link in (INITIATIVE-KEY)
Create a plan based on this filter

h3. Expected Result
Initiative and Epic show up in the scope table in the correct hierarchy.

h3. Actual Result
The epic is not a child of the initiative.

h3. Notes
This also appears to break Portfolio's ability to properly bring sprints into the plan as well as the ability to plan stories into undefined sprints.
fields.summary: Using Portfolio's Parent Link field in the issue source filter corrupts the hierarchy

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1188].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
* User are unable to create or link issue using portfolio using Portfolio's "Create and link issues" feature
* The following error are shown:
{code}
Cannot read property 'CreateIssueModel' of undefined
TypeError: Cannot read property 'CreateIssueModel' of undefined
{code}

h3. Notes
A confirmed Bug, fix is on its way

h3.Workaround
* Manually activate JIRA's "Create issue" dialog immediately before using Portfolio's "Create and link issues" feature (this forces the missing JavaScript resources to be loaded before Portfolio tries to use them). It must be done from within the same browser tab, and will only work until the page is refreshed/closed.
fields.summary: Opening JIRA's "Create Issue" dialog fails
